And I get to be her friend at least, so it was win win. You fucking light up my life! You do that to me. I went to the bar just to see you! You were the only reason I had on several occassions to keep going! I looked forward to just being around you, that kept me going. So now I’m returning the favor, I wanna be that person that you lean on when you need help, I’m here for you, and I’m not trying to fuck you, I’m here as your friend because at the end of the day, when all the bullshit’s done, that’s who sticks around...your friends. MAGGIE gets up off the ground and hugs MIKE and begins crying in earnest.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, I had no idea, I’m really sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It’s okay really, just, it’s okay. I promise. MAGGIE lifts her head and her nose is touching MIKE’s nos their lips are inches apart.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: MIKE, why, why do you care? There is a couple seconds of silence as MAGGIE and MIKE never break intense eye contact. (CONTINUED) www.BarRoomHero.com  42 www. BarRoomHero.com 92.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Because your someone special, to me. I don’t wanna see you hurt, because, I, I fucking---because, I love you. MAGGIE passionately kisses MIKE and he returns the kiss. INT. The bed sun The

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: - MAGGIE’S HOUSE - BEDROOM - DAWN scene fades to black and reopens with the two of them in together, holding hands and looking at each other. The is coming in through the curtains. bedroom is sparsely decorated and there are even more boxes in this room sealed up.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: (laughing) I hope you don’t think I’m some sort of slut or anything.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Never that Ms. Maybe a little...adventurous, especially after....um the last...two hours. The two of them start laughing and she leans over and giv him a quick kiss.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I just want you to know that last night meant alot to me, and the things you said to me were more than likely the nicest things anyone had ever said to me, ever!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I meant every single word I said. You don’t have to thank me, I was scared actually.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Why? Why would you have been scared? You should of said those things earlier maybe things would of been different. (CONTINUED) www.BarRoomHero.com  www. BarRoomHero.com 93.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (laughing) I wasn’t scared about that, and no, I think this happened at the right time, if I would of said something sooner the timing wouldn’t had been right and it just, you know stuff happens when it’s supposed to, not when we want it to but when it’s meant to happen. you know? MAGGIE stares at MIKE for a second INT.ently and then she smiles slightly. They both arms.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I like that, I do and it makes perfect sense. Now answer my question jerk, what were you scared about?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It’s stupid but, well, I guess I was scared about just barging in the second time last night, I mean you were so pissed that I didn’t know if you were gonna mace me, hit me with a bat or fucking punch me, you totally hulked out on me last night, I felt like Whitney and you were Bobby. start laughing and MAGGIE snuggles into MIKE’s

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: MIKE, I want you to know, that, well, I’ve never met someone like you before, I really mean that.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Well, thanks---I think.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: It’s totally a good thing. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I hope so, jeez.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: God, I wish this could last forever, I wish we could lay here and never have to get up. (CONTINUED) www.BarRoomHero.com  www. BarRoomHero.com 94.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Well we do have all morning and afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I have a final meeting with my lawyer this morning though. I get to sign my final divorce papers now. So unfortunately I have to get up and get ready.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Oh---Okay, at least that’s going to be one worry off your mind.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Your ain’t lying, I may cry again but at least this time it’1ll be tears of fucking sweet, swwet pleasure!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Well, what are you doing later? Maybe we can grab a drink or maybe just watch a movie? I mean if you don’t want to that’s totally fine, you know, I understand.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Um, yea---we can meet up at the bar, that sounds cool. Wanna meet me around 9ish?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sounds like a plan Missy!

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Okay but uh, um, you know, I don’t have to be at the lawyer’s office for another hour sooo---

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Well then, allow me to INT.roduce you to a little move I like to call the Dibbler! MIKE and MAGGIE roll over in the bed together giggling an laughing as the scene fades.

dialogues.speaker: FADE OUT
